title-part.text: ARRANGEMENT OR MOUNTING OF PROPULSION UNITS OR OF TRANSMISSIONS IN VEHICLES
ARRANGEMENT OR MOUNTING OF PLURAL DIVERSE PRIME-MOVERS IN VEHICLES
ARRANGEMENTS IN CONNECTION WITH COOLING, AIR INTAKE, GAS EXHAUST OR FUEL SUPPLY OF PROPULSION UNITS IN VEHICLES

note.note-paragraph: In this subclass, the following terms or expressions are used with the meanings indicated: "conjoint control of drive units" includes such control for vehicles or of general applicability; "auxiliary drives" means drives of auxiliary or external machines or devices from the propulsion unit, transmission, or other parts of the vehicle, and includes the control of such drives; "transmission" means all propulsion parts linking propulsion units, e.g. engines, to ultimate propulsive elements, e.g. wheels; "drive unit" means propulsion unit conjoint with transmission, a "drive unit" can additionally include the ultimate driven unit; "sub-unit" means, e.g. propulsion unit, clutch, gearing or brake system; "hybrid vehicle" means vehicles with plural diverse prime-movers for mutual or common propulsion
Attention is drawn to the Note following the title of class B60
In this subclass non-limiting references (in the sense of paragraph 39 of the Guide to the IPC) may still be displayed in the scheme.

title-part.text: Arrangement or mounting of propulsion units in vehicles

reference.text: of control devices for such units B60K26/00; elastic mountings per se F16F; propulsion units or their control per se, see the relevant classes

Group B60K1/04 is impacted by reclassification into group B60L53/80.
Groups B60K1/04 and B60L53/80 should be considered in order to perform a complete search.

title-part.text: Arrangement or mounting of plural diverse prime-movers for mutual or common propulsion, e.g. hybrid propulsion systems comprising electric motors and internal combustion engines

CPC-specific-text.text: ; Control systems therefor, i.e. systems controlling two or more prime movers, or controlling one of these prime movers and any of the transmission, drive or drive units

reference.text: arrangement or mounting in vehicles of electrical gearing, in which an electrical machine serves only as reduction gearing and not as the prime mover and in which no electrical storing means are used B60K17/12; control and regulation of purely electrical prime movers B60L; prime-movers comprising electrical and internal combustion motors in a common engine block or housing per se F02B65/00; electric motors or motor-generators used for starting the combustion engine F02N11/04; electric motors for synchronising gearing F16H3/12

CPC-specific-text.text: Informative references: mechanical gearings with secondary electric drive F16H3/72; arrangements for handling mechanical energy structurally associated with the dynamo-electric machine H02K7/00; machines comprising structurally interrelated motor and generator parts H02K51/00; dynamo-electric machines not otherwise provided for in H02K see H02K99/00

note.note-paragraph: In this subgroup, the following expressions are used, with the meanings indicated : "energy storing means" means apparatus for storing propulsive energy and providing stored energy to drive the prime mover or the ultimate propulsive elements "hybrid electric vehicle" (HEV) means a vehicle with an electrical prime mover and a combustion engine, in which the electrical prime mover and the combustion engine either singly or in combination, drive the ultimate propulsive elements, e.g. wheels "motor-generator" means an electric motor, or an electric generator, or an electrical machine which can be used for both functions, as a motor or a generator "prime mover" means a propulsion unit or source of motive power providing a mechanical output, e.g. via a rotating shaft

note.note-paragraph: When classifying in this group, details of sail or rigging arrangements which are suited for marine wind propulsion are also classified in the relevant groups of subclass B63H, e.g. in groups B63H8/00, B63H9/04.

Group B60K16/00 is impacted by reclassification into groups B63H8/00 - B63H8/70, B63H9/04, B63H9/06, B63H9/061, B63H9/065, B63H9/067 and B63H9/068 - B63H9/072.
All groups listed in this Warning should be considered in order to perform a complete search.

reference.text: fittings acting on two or more sub-units B60W30/14; propulsion unit control in general, see the relevant classes or subclasses, e.g. F02D; speedometers G01P; systems or devices for controlling speed in general G05D13/00;

CPC-specific-text.text: in traffic anti-collision system for road vehicles G08G1/16

note.note-paragraph: In this group: the means ordinarily includes a device, e.g. a servomechanism, for operating a velocity-affecting element of the vehicle, e.g. the throttle; a means for preventing a vehicle from exceeding a particular speed is often referred to as a "governor", whereas a means for maintaining the vehicle within a relatively narrow speed range is generally designated as "speed control". Since these two functions are frequently interrelated, no attempt has been made to identify such means as being particularly adapted to perform only one, or the other of the functions.

CPC-specific-text.text: including means for detecting potential obstacles in vehicle path
Identification of obstacles; Selection of a target vehicle
Detecting position of target vehicle, e.g. vehicle driving ahead from host vehicle
Detecting longitudinal speed or acceleration of target vehicle
Detecting lateral speed of target vehicle
Selecting more than one target vehicle, e.g. using several preceding vehicles as target
responsive to externally generated signalling
responsive to vehicle path curvature
responsive to vehicle steering angle
responsive to centrifugal force acting on vehicle due to the path it is following
Speed limiters or speed cutters
including an electric control system or a servomechanism in which the vehicle velocity affecting element is actuated electrically

title-part.text: and means for comparing one electrical quantity, e.g. voltage, pulse, waveform, flux, or the like, with another quantity of a like kind, which comparison means is involved in the development of an electrical signal which is fed into the controlling means

CPC-specific-text.text: where at least one electrical quantity is set by the vehicle operator
in a memory, e.g. a capacitor
the memory being digital
in which the vehicle velocity affecting element is actuated by fluid pressure

title-part.text: and one or more electrical components for establishing or regulating input pressure

and means for comparing one electrical quantity, e.g. voltage, pulse, waveform, flux, or the like, with another quantity of a like kind, which comparison means is involved in the development of a pressure which is fed into the controlling means

CPC-specific-text.text: where at least one electrical quantity is set by the vehicle operator
in a memory, e.g. a capacitor
the memory being digital

title-part.text: including a device responsive to centrifugal forces

reference.text: centrifugal force acting on the vehicle due to the path it is following B60K31/0083, motor speed limiting by governors G05D13/10

title-part.text: having an electrical switch which is caused to function by the centrifugal force
having means to prevent or discourage unauthorised use or adjusting of the controlling means

reference.text: vehicle theft prevention in general B60R25/00

title-part.text: including a device to audibly, visibly, or otherwise signal the existence of unusual or unintended speed

CPC-specific-text.text: to the driver of the vehicle

reference.text: devices primarily intended for indicating speed to other traffic B60Q1/54

CPC-specific-text.text: connected to the speedometer display, e.g. by sensors or switches responsive to the position of the indicator needle

reference.text: arrangement of pointers in automobile speedometers for indicating predetermined speeds by the detection of the position of the indicator needle G01P1/11

title-part.text: Arrangement of adaptations of instruments specially for vehicles

reference.text: arrangements on dashboard B60K37/02
as road-vehicle superstructure sub-unit B62D
arrangement of lighting devices for dashboards B60Q3/10
of instruments B60K37/02

title-part.text: Arrangements, adaptations or methods for cruise controls
Operator actuated switches or levers for cruise control or speed limiting systems
setting initial target speed, e.g. initial algorithms
changing target speed or setting a new target speed, e.g. changing algorithms
releasing speed control, e.g. inhibiting speed control if a brake pedal is depressed
resuming speed control, e.g. returning to old target speed
Distance setting methods, e.g. determining target distance to target vehicle
setting initial distance to preceding vehicle, e.g. initial algorithms
changing distance, e.g. reducing the distance for overtaking
releasing distance control, e.g. inhibiting control if target vehicle lost or changing lane
resuming distance control, e.g. changing target vehicle
Following time setting methods, e.g. elapsed delay between preceding and host vehicle
Mode switching, e.g. changing from one cruise control mode to another
Arrangement or mounting of propulsion units in vehicles

reference.text: of control devices for such units B60K26/00; elastic mountings per se F16F; propulsion units or their control per se, see the relevant classes

title-part.text: Details of arrangements or adaptations of instruments specially adapted for vehicles, not covered by groups B60K35/00, B60K37/00
Graphical user interfaces or menu aspects
with reconfigurable control functions, e.g. reconfigurable menus
Activation by approaching fingers or pens
Input by combination of touch screen and hardware input devices
Simultaneous multiple use of display matrix, e.g. to display information and to illuminate pointer
Displays on a manual operation element
Combined instruments with analogue meters and additional displays
Vehicle or relevant part thereof displayed
Displaying the same information on different displays
Blocking or enabling of input functions
for instruments which are not visible when inactive
Optical elements for superposition of display information
Hardware adaptations for dashboards or instruments
using wireless power transfer or transmission.
Structural details of dashboards or instruments
Dashboard parts used as air ducts
Arrangements to cover or hide instruments
with only part of pointer being visible
Arrangements of instruments in the vehicle
with special adaptation to the user or to the vehicle
characterised by locations other than the dashboard
on or in the centre console
on or in rear view mirrors
on or in relation to the windshield or windows
on or in the transmission tunnel or parking brake lever
Fastening of instruments, e.g. to dashboard
Fastening of displays or touch screens
Fixation of dashboard to vehicle structure
Control mechanisms and elements applying a mechanical movement
regulating mechanisms combined with non-mechanical transmissions

Control devices wherein the control is combined with or essentially influenced by the engine or coupling, e.g. in an internal combustion engine, the control device is coupled with a carburettor control device or influenced by carburettor depression
Semi-automatic or non-automatic transmission with toothed gearing
the control being hydraulic or pneumatic
with a preselection system, e.g. semi-automatic
using different control members for preselection and actuating, e.g. shift actuation is initiated by clutch pedal with elastic connection for energy accumulation

Control devices, wherein the control is combined with or mainly influenced by the working of the engine or the main coupling, e.g. control device is linked to the carburettor control and is influenced by depression of pedal, for semi-automatic or non-automatic transmission having toothed wheels
without preselection system, the control being mechanical
with preselection system, e.g. for semi-autonmatic transmission
